sorular.soru: What speed must a motor vehicle be capable of and allowed to travel at to drive on the motorway?

feedback.metin: Motor vehicles must be capable of and allowed to travel at a minimum of 60 km/h to drive on the motorway. On autowegen motor vehicles must be capable of and allowed to travel at a minimum of 50 km/h.

sorular.soru: Should you give right of way to the following cars in the funeral procession?

feedback.metin: Cutting through funeral processions is prohibited. However, follower cars in a funeral procession may not drive through red lights, even if the hearse has already entered the intersection at a green light. Therefore you are not required to give right of way to them. Make sure the follower cars do, in fact, wait at the red light. The drivers of these vehicles may be emotional and therefore, less attentive to traffic.

sorular.soru: What oncoming traffic should you expect here?
cevaplar: Everything but cyclists or moped riders.

feedback.metin: This sign combination indicates that there is a dead end for all vehicles, except for cyclists and moped riders. That the road leads to a dead end does not mean that you do not have oncoming traffic. All vehicles could come from the other direction, cyclists and moped riders for whom the road continues as other vehicles for whom the road leads to a dead end. They have to exit the road from the way they came.

sorular.soru: What is the minimum tread depth of trailer tyres?

feedback.metin: Trailer tyres must comply with the same rules as passenger car tyres. The tread depth must be at least 1.6 mm for trailer tyres too.

sorular.soru: What do you do if you see a traffic jam form a little further on?
cevaplar: Shift down immediately and slow down.
Slow down on time and turn on your hazard lights.
Brake harshly and keep your distance.
sorular.dogruCevap: Slow down on time and turn on your hazard lights.

feedback.metin: Never brake harshly when this is not necessary. Also, never shift down too early but let the car roll out in a higher gear. Do you see a traffic jam form further on, warn other traffic participants with the help of your hazard lights and brake on time, more than that is not necessary.

sorular.soru: What does this sign indicate?
cevaplar: The route to the main road.
sorular.dogruCevap: The route to the main road.

feedback.metin: The sign 'Doorgaand verkeer' indicates which direction you should follow to end up on a main road. For example, It indicates the through route through a residential area. It is not a detour route and you are also not required to follow this route.

sorular.soru: Is a moped categorised as a motor vehicle?

feedback.metin: All motorised vehicles that do not require rails to operate are categorised as motor vehicles, with the exception of mopeds, snorfietsen, bicycles with pedal support, and disabled vehicles. A moped is therefore not categorised as a motor vehicle.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to indicate while waiting for an opportunity to merge?

feedback.metin: You may only indicate when you are actually going to merge. You may not force a space by using your indicator.

sorular.soru: You want to go straight ahead. Should you give way to the red car?

feedback.metin: If the traffic lights are out of order, or if the traffic light does not have a directional arrow but a circle, the rule 'through traffic on the same road goes before traffic turning off' still applies. You are driving straight ahead and therefore do not have to give way to the red car turning off.

sorular.soru: What should you do if the brake pedal starts to vibrate during an emergency stop in a car equipped with ABS?
cevaplar: Keep the brake pedal fully pressed.
Release the brake pedal for a moment and then apply it again.
sorular.dogruCevap: Keep the brake pedal fully pressed.

feedback.metin: During an emergency stop in a car with ABS, you will notice that the brake pedal vibrates when you hit it hard. This is due to the ABS acting on the brake force, which prevents the wheels from locking. If you (briefly) release the brake pedal at that moment, the car will not brake through and the stopping distance will become longer. So keep applying the brake until you come to a standstill.

sorular.soru: What does this white flashing light mean?
cevaplar: The installation is broken or out of order.
You can drive on, no train is approaching.
You must wait for an approaching train.
sorular.dogruCevap: You can drive on, no train is approaching.

feedback.metin: Here, you are approaching a level crossing without crossing barriers. When the top white light is flashing, no train is approaching and it is safe to cross. When a train is approaching, the two lower red lights will flash alternately.

sorular.soru: What is the best behaviour in this situation?
cevaplar: Brake lightly to scare the tailgater.
Drive faster to create more space behind you.
Stay calm and merge to the right lane as soon as it is safe to do so.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stay calm and merge to the right lane as soon as it is safe to do so.

feedback.metin: Never feel rushed, and always stay calm. Maintain enough distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you. Make room as soon as it is safe to do so. Never use the brake to scare the tailgater. This can lead to serious accidents for which you will be held liable as you have unnecessarily endangered other road users.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to merge here?

feedback.metin: If there is a right arrow on the road surface, you are only allowed to exit, even if there is block marking. You are not allowed to enter the main carriageway again.

sorular.soru: You cannot find your driving licence momentarily. Are you allowed to drive a passenger car?

feedback.metin: While driving a motor carriage, you should always have your driving licence with you. So make sure you do not lose it. This is because even if you cannot find your driving licence momentarily, you are not allowed to drive.

sorular.soru: How fast are you allowed to drive here at noon?

feedback.metin: The signs indicate that you are on a motorway. On motorways, between 6:00 AM and 7:00 PM there is a speed limit of 100 km/h.

sorular.soru: What should you do first to help?
cevaplar: Ensure the safety of any victims.

feedback.metin: Ensure your own safety first at all times. Pay attention to potential hazards such as smoke, fire, and traffic. Try to determine how many victims there are and what their condition is. Avoid moving victims as this may exacerbate any injuries. Contact the emergency services by calling 112, before attending to any victims.

sorular.soru: The barriers are going up again. Are you allowed to continue driving?
cevaplar: No. You must wait until the red light has gone out.
Yes. Unless the bells begin to ring again.
No. You must wait until the barriers are fully up.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. You must wait until the red light has gone out.

feedback.metin: You may only cross a level crossing once the red light has gone out. Even if the barriers are already going up, a train may pass on the other side.

sorular.soru: You are driving 70 km/h. Are you now allowed to increase your speed?

feedback.metin: If you are being overtaken by another vehicle, increasing your speed is not allowed as it puts yourself and other drivers at risk.

sorular.soru: What is the name of the area around the vehicle that you cannot see directly?

feedback.metin: The blind spot is the space around a vehicle that the driver cannot see directly. For example, the space directly in front of and directly behind the vehicle and the space immediately adjacent to the vehicle. Blind spots are also caused by window and door pillars. Lorries, in particular, suffer from large blind spots due to the size of the vehicle.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here without a disabled parking permit if your passenger has his leg in a cast?

feedback.metin: Parking on a disabled parking space with your passenger car is only allowed if you or your passenger has a disabled parking permit. Even if your passenger visibly cannot walk properly, you are not allowed to park here. However, you may let the passenger get out if you drive off yourself afterwards.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to flash the full-beam headlights to warn the driver in front of you?

feedback.metin: The driver of the passenger car in front of you has no lights on in the dark and is thus a danger on the road. To avert danger, you may flash the full-beam headlights to warn the driver in front of you.

sorular.soru: What are you allowed to do here?

feedback.metin: If there is a yellow broken line on the kerb, parking is prohibited. Only picking up or dropping off passengers and loading and unloading goods is allowed here. Waiting for someone is not included, as this is parking.

sorular.soru: Heavy snowfall has severely impaired visibility. Are you allowed to use the front fog lights?

feedback.metin: If the visibility is severely impaired due to rain, snow or fog, you are allowed to use the front fog lights.

sorular.soru: Must you use sidelights in combination with rear lights when parking here?
cevaplar: No. You do not have to use any lighting while parking.
Yes. But only when parking on the carriageway.
Yes. Both on the verge and the carriageway.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. But only when parking on the carriageway.

feedback.metin: Sidelights must be used in combination with rear lights when parking on a carriageway outside of built-up areas at night. This requirement does not apply to verges or within built-up areas on the carriageway.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to move one lane to the left here?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to move one lane to the left. You are not allowed to cross the solid line, because the broken line is on the left of this line and not on your side. Vehicles left of these lines are allowed to move to the right.

sorular.soru: Do you continue following the motorway here?

feedback.metin: You are driving on a lane that is ending. You have to move one lane to the right. However, the motorway does not end here, you keep following it.

sorular.soru: Is it mandatory to have a warning triangle in the car?

feedback.metin: It is not mandatory to have a warning triangle in the car. However, it is better to keep one in the car anyway. If you stop due to a breakdown and you cannot use your hazard lights, you are required to use a warning triangle.

sorular.soru: Where does it say when your car is required to be re-inspected for the APK?

feedback.metin: Cars must be inspected periodically. The first inspection after purchase for petrol and hybrid cars takes place after 4 years. For diesel cars this is after 3 years. Then, petrol and hybrid cars must be inspected after two years, this happens twice and after that every year. Diesel cars must be inspected every year after the first inspection. The date before which the car must be re-examined is stated on the inspection certificate.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the motorcyclist?

feedback.metin: It is too foggy to see if oncoming traffic is approaching. It is not safe to overtake here and it is therefore prohibited.

sorular.soru: What is a brommobiel?
cevaplar: A moped on three or four wheels.
sorular.dogruCevap: A moped on three or four wheels.

feedback.metin: A brommobiel is a moped on three or four wheels with bodywork. To drive a brommobiel, you must be at least 16 years old and have a valid AM driving licence. Despite the fact that a brommobiel must follow the rules of conduct applicable to motor vehicles, it is not a motor vehicle, but a moped. It is not a disabled vehicle, because it is wider than 1.10 metres.

sorular.soru: What is the correct following distance in good road and weather conditions?

feedback.metin: The correct following distance is always the distance at which you have enough room to be able to stop in time under any circumstances. Under favourable conditions, the 2-second rule is sufficient, whereby you maintain a following distance of 2 seconds between your car and the vehicle in front of you. In case of poor road or weather conditions, you are required to maintain a minimum following distance of 3 to 4 seconds, depending on the speed at which you are travelling.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake here?

feedback.metin: A solid white line indicates that you are not allowed to overtake. It does not matter whether there are one or two solid lines.

sorular.soru: Can you park here?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to park in front of an entrance or exit, even if it is your own entrance or exit.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: A priority road outside built-up areas is meant as a fast connection between various places. Drivers may not park on the carriageway of a priority road outside built-up areas. Therefore you are not allowed to park here.

sorular.soru: How do you adjust the headrest properly?
cevaplar: The bottom of the headrest must be level with the shoulder.
The top of the headrest must be level with the top of the head.
The bottom of the headrest must be level with the ears.
sorular.dogruCevap: The top of the headrest must be level with the top of the head.

feedback.metin: A number of safety features aim to prevent or limit injuries as a result of a collision, including headrests. It is important to ensure headrests are properly adjusted. These should be as close as possible to the head, with the top of the headrest level with the top of the head.

sorular.soru: You got into an accident with only minor collision damage. Where do you fill in the damage claim form?
cevaplar: In a safe place such as a parking lot.
You always do this at home, within 5 working days.
At the scene of the accident itself.
sorular.dogruCevap: In a safe place such as a parking lot.

feedback.metin: If you had an accident with only minor collision damage, do not stay at the scene of the accident to handle everything. This causes extra inconvenience and danger. With the other party, find a safe place such as a parking lot, and handle everything there. Together, fill in the front of the damage claim form, you should both sign it. After that, divide the damage claim form (one person keeps the original, the other the carbon copy). Of these, you fill in the back of the form at home as quickly as possible. You both send your own part to the insurance company. Do you fill in the damage claim form digitally? Then you also do this together. The app tells you how to do this.

sorular.soru: How far in advance should you indicate if you want to exit a motorway?

feedback.metin: If you want to exit a motorway, you must indicate this well in advance. Approximately 300 metres before an exit, indicate right. This lets other drivers know what you are planning to do.
